The State Health Insurance Assistance Program (SHIP) is a government program with
trained counselors in every state. In New Mexico
column2: the SHIP is called New Mexico Aging

column1: and Long-Term Services Department.
New Mexico Aging and Long-Term Services Department is an independent (not
connected with any insurance company or health plan) state program that gets money
from the Federal government to give free local health insurance counseling to people
with Medicare.
New Mexico Aging and Long-Term Services Department counselors can help you
understand your Medicare rights
column2: help you make complaints about your medical care

column1: or treatment
column2: and help you straighten out problems with your Medicare bills. New

column1: Mexico Aging and Long-Term Services Department counselors can also help you with
Medicare questions or problems and help you understand your Medicare plan choices
and answer questions about switching plans.
